citations.narrative:
A video of a visitor picking vegetation and feeding a rabbit through the fence of the enclosure was submitted as a
complaint. Upon inspection it was confirmed that a section of the wooden barrier fence along the enclosure wall was not
complete, allowing the public access to the enclosure. Barriers to contact between the public and animals assist in
avoiding injury and the prevention of ingestion of non nutritive materials. The facility must ensure that sufficient distance
and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public is present during public exhibition to ensure safety.
The facility representative immediately placed a temporary barrier on the end of the fence at the time of inspection.
Correct by August 23, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
A video of a visitor picking vegetation and feeding a rabbit through the fence of the enclosure was submitted as a 
complaint. Upon inspection it was confirmed that a section of the wooden barrier fence along the enclosure wall was not 
complete, allowing the public access to the enclosure. Barriers to contact between the public and animals assist in 
avoiding injury and the prevention of ingestion of non nutritive materials. The facility must ensure that sufficient distance 
and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public is present during public exhibition to ensure safety. 
 
The facility representative immediately placed a temporary barrier on the end of the fence at the time of inspection. 
Correct by August 23, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
